data.title: Neighborhood Taqueria - es Bueno!
data.text: We've been here several times with each visit ensuring a return. The servers have always been friendly and responsive. The place is on the small side but can adapt to accommodate various size parties, it has energy.  There's a large bar and they have lots of drink choices, naturally tequila being a main ingredient. While the menu may seem to offer traditional Mexican fare and a variety of ceviche dishes, the preparation and food are not -- obviously very fresh, and the seasonings set this taqueria apart from what you might expect. Quality food, nice people and moderately prices - you can;t go wrong here.

data.title: Good!
data.text: I have eaten at this location quite a few times, and love the food. I especially like the tacos and quesadillas, but I think everything is pretty good here. Service has always been OK too. Parking is easy in Alph, and this venue is wheelchair accessible which is important for us as we travel with our different-abled daughter.

data.title: Great place, great food
data.text: We were there a few days ago on a weekend, my wife drank a Margarita (she love it)!!!  food was serve fast and it was delicious

data.title: Good Food, TOO NOISY
data.text: Very good tacos, but it is like eating in a shower stall. Incredibly noisy! Will eat outside next time, or will pass...

data.title: Fun place
data.text: This is a nice little place to get tacos. They have a great little porch that you can sit and and watch to day fade into night. Pretty good food too.

data.title: Really good Mexican Food
data.text: We were visiting family and went here for lunch. This was our first visit to Ceviche and very pleasantly surprised, much better than the last restaurant in this town. Chips & salsa were excellent as was the burrito. Everyone enjoyed their food. Even the kids loved the quesadillas.

data.title: Great location, average food
data.text:
We had a large group of 15 people to celebrate a birthday party.  

The good:  They took reservations and accommodated us outdoors (on time). The friendly wait staff did a nice job of taking care of all of us and didn't complain about us having separate checks.  The food came out on time and correctly.  Drinks were good.

The average:  I had the steak fajitas - they seemed a bit bland.  Many of my friends tried the ceviches (different kinds).  Way too many chopped tomatoes - not even sure you are supposed to put tomatoes on true ceviche.  They didn't clear the table off until the end - we had a lot of dishes.

data.title: Great tacos and margaritas in Alpharetta
data.text: The downtown are of Alpharetta surprises me every time I go there.  It always seems another good restaurant opens up.  We saw Ceviche while visiting the farmers market earlier in the day and decided to come back and check it out.  We sat outside on an unusually nice summer night (not sticky).  The tacos here are fantastic.  I tried everyone's at the table and all were excellent.  Someone also got enchiladas and said those were great.  they've got an extensive margarita list and a good beer selection.  Pricing is very reasonable.

data.title: Food was worth the wait!
data.text: Great selection of ceviche.  I had the ceviche trio and the three I tried were great.  I tried the mahi mahi, scallop and shrimp ceviche.  The restaurant also has a deck and we were able to take our dog.  I would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: ❤️
data.text: Great new restaurant in downtown Alpharetta!  Good service, excellent fish tacos & margaritas! We have some great choices for Mexican food in Alpharetta, but this is our new favorite! We'll be back!

data.title: Good addition to downtown Alpharetta
data.text: Glad to see this second location of Cerviche in Alpharetta. It is well located in the heart of the downtown Alpharetta area. It has a nice deck for outdoor dining and many interesting food choices. The service was efficient and friendly. Will be back.

data.title: Taco Tuesdays!!
data.text: Love this addition to downtown Alpharetta!I've always enjoyed their food in Roswell but never experienced Taco Tuesdays! They have $2 chicken and beef tacos and trivia that night too. Our family loves it! We go on other days too--enchiladas are yummy, but it is nice to have a family friendly place for dinner that is reasonable. While we love good food, the place that will keep us coming back doesn't look down their nose at us. Ceviche is that place. Adults want excellent food, reasonable prices and a causal atmosphere..hard to find downtown these days, but this place fits the bill!

data.title: Only place I've found a variety of ceviche
data.text: This is a pretty good taqueria in the heart of Alpharetta. We had chips and queso, beef empanadas,  and the pro sampler of ceviche - Mahi, tilapia,  and shrimp. The empanadas were very good and delicious. Almost authentic. Cups and queso were like every other Mexican restaurant except we ordered with jalapeños and it came without jalapeños. The ceviche... was not authentic but a nice try I suppose. It tasted as if the fish was precooked and therefore was unable to absorb the delicious flavors of the lime, onions, cilantro and peppers that they should of. It fell flat which was disappointing considering its the restaurants namesake. Service wasn't bad but the server wanted to take our plates for some reason while we were eating. Not a terrible experience and had I not had authentic ceviche before, I would probably have rated higher because this is one of the few restaurants that even serves ceviche.

data.title: Friendly Cafe/Bar in old town Alpharetta
data.text: Ceviche has really friendly and efficient servers.  The kitchen ignored the request for no cheese on one of our orders, but the server made it right.  Good ceviche and tacos.  About half authentic Mexican dishes, half Tex-Mex.  Good selection of tequilas and other spirits.  Something for everyone here.  We will  go back.

data.title: Good Downtown Spot for Food and Sports
data.text:
I had lunch there recently. Chips and salsa to start were crispy and fresh. 
The tilapia sandwich was nicely cooked and included a tasty remoulade. I requested very well done sweet potato fries and they were delicious. 
They have a great bar space inside and lot's of outdoor seating under a canopy in the alley, both with many TV's. 
Service was prompt and friendly. 
I will be back for a sports event.

data.title: Good Tex Mex In Alpharetta
data.text: This is a very casual Mexican restaurant in Alpharetta. Very similar to the original one on Canton Street in Roswell. Very high quality food and fast service. Low to moderate prices

data.title: Food just okay, maybe we ordered the wrong thing
data.text: Had dinner there with another couple on a Friday evening.  We had no trouble getting a table, though the restaurant was fairly full.  The waiter was reasonably attentive, though we didn't task him too much, and i sensed that he was disappointed that we did not order more alcohol.  The food was just okay.  I ordered the Arroz Mexicano, and my husband had the pork barbacoa.  The taste of the Arroz Mexicano was just average, and the barbacoa was excessively salty for both of us.  Our friend had the skinny margarita, which she ended up not drinking, feeling that there was too much tequila in it.  And the restaurant would not let her have different kinds of enchiladas, so she and her husband each had to order a different kind and then split their plates so that they could have a variety.  Overall, it was a lackluster performance.  Pricing was mostly between $11-$15 for most entrees, but for the quality of food, seemed slightly overpriced.

data.title: Fabulous Taqueria in Alpharetta
data.text: We visit Ceviche almost every Tuesday evening for our family "Taco Tuesday" night. We've been at least 10 times by now. The service is fast and friendly. The food is great!  There are nightly specials and although we don't order them, the drinks look wonderful. Love this place.

data.title: GREAT FOOD INDIFFERENT SERVICE
data.text: The Deluxe Burrito is the best on the planet, but the service almost always is lousy. They act as if it is a favor to serve you. If they screw up, they never apologize

data.title: Good Mexican food and nice location in downtown Alpharetta...
data.text:
The food was very good and it's a fun location right downtown Alpharetta.  The outdoor seating was limited, but nice.  The inside atmosphere could use some work.

The chicken enchiladas verde were excellent and the service was terrific!  They need an expanded beer list however, as their selection isn't any better than the basic Tex-Mex places around.

Overall, was very pleased and will go back, but I'd still give the nod to Pure for best Mexican in Alpharetta.
